projectile_info.attached_effect2_description: trail after it runs out of fuel
projectile_info.attached_effect3_description: initial trail before the fuel starts
projectile_info.attached_effect4_description: effect when the fuel kicks in

projectile_info.attached_effect2_description: flashing light like the remote charge
trail after it runs out of fuel
projectile_info.attached_effect3_description: initial trail before the fuel starts
projectile_info.attached_effect4_description: effect when the fuel kicks in

projectile_info.attached_effect2_description: trail after it runs out of fuel
projectile_info.attached_effect3_description: initial trail before the fuel starts

projectile_info.attached_effect2_description: flashing light like the remote charge

element.name: name
element.description: unique name for this weapon.

element.name: unique_id
element.description: unique integer used by mp. do not try to reuse values if adding. just keep adding. you can get last used index by looking at output generated by starting game and looking for "max weapon unique_id:"

element.name: inventory_item
element.description: inventory item for this weapon.

element.name: item_3d
element.description: item 3d for this weapon.

element.name: default_team
element.description: the default team for this weapon

element.name: icon_name
element.description: name of the icon to show on the hud for this weapon

element.name: small_icon_name
element.description: name of the icon to show on the hud for kill messages with this weapon

element.name: reticule_name
element.description: name of the reticule to show on the hud for this weapon

element.name: fine_aim_reticule
element.description: name of the image for the fine aim reticule

element.name: mp_kill_phrase
element.description:
phrase to use in the message on the hud when a player is killed with this weapon. you can use these tokens in it:
%attacker - name of the attacker or in a suicide, the player that died
%victim - name of the victim. in a suicide death, %victim becomes %himself.
%icon - the small icon
%his - his/her/your, if local player's suicide
%himself - himself/herself/yourself, if local player's suicide

element.name: weapon_class
element.description: the class of the weapon, which affects how weapon behave gameside

element.name: trigger_type
element.description: "single" (button press required for each shot) or "automatic" (hold button down for multiple shots) or "charge" requires to be held until fires

element.name: ammo_type
element.description: determines interface requirements and hit processing "bullet" - hit detection occurs immediately on trigger pull "projectile" - launched from a weapon, requires hit detection each frame "thrown" - thrown by hand, requires hit detection each frame "melee" - melee attack "energy" - energy based weapon

element.name: bullet_group
element.description: define the effect group to use for bullet impact effects

element.name: animation_group
element.description: which group of animation to use from the animation set of the character

element.name: magazine_size
element.description: number of rounds in a single magazine (ignored for "thrown" and "melee" weapons).

element.name: num_magazines
element.description: this specifies the number of magazines the weapon should spawn with by default. this number here includes the clip loaded in the weapon.

element.name: max_rounds
element.description: maximum number of rounds the player can hold for this weapon (ignored for "melee" weapons).

element.name: max_rounds_upgrade
element.description: maximum number of rounds the player can hold for this weapon after purchasing ammo upgrade.

element.name: ammo_box_restock
element.description: how much ammo is given to the player when they restock at an ammo box.

element.name: default_refire_delay
element.description: delay between shots (in milliseconds, ignored for "thrown" and "melee" weapons).

element.name: prefire_delay
element.description: time (in ms) between when the trigger is pulled and the first shot is fired.

element.name: range_max
element.description: maximum range an npc will try to use the weapon at

element.name: range_red
element.description: range in which the target must be for the reticle to appear red.

element.name: min_engagement_distance
element.description: minimum desired npc engagement range. an npc may still fire under this range, but will attempt to move back outside this range to fire on his target

element.name: max_engagement_distance
element.description: maximum desired npc engagement range. an npc will use a weapon outside this range, but will attempt to close to this range to fire on his target

element.name: max_ai_penetrating_distance
element.description: max distance at which ai will shoot through walls to get you - only applies to penetrating weapons.

element.name: explosion
element.description: the explosion associated with this weapon.

element.name: aiexplosion
element.description: the explosion used by the ai for this weapon

element.name: shots_per_round
element.description: number of shots emitted per round (defaults to one).

element.name: player_move_speed
element.description: multiplier of the players move speed while equipped with this weapon.

element.name: npc_move_speed
element.description: multiplier of an npcs move speed while equipped with this weapon.

element.name: fire_cone_angle
element.description: angle of cone extending that shots are randomized within.

element.name: even_spread_accuracy_angle
element.description: in the even spread firing system, this says how random each bullet will be (relative to that particular bullet's predetermined offset.) note: a value of 0 will cause the bullets to have a perfectly even spread from the center of the firing cone.

element.name: recoil_kick
element.description: how much recoil (upwards camera kick) is applied when this weapon is fired (only applies to player).

element.name: recoilimpulse
element.description: impulse of weapon recoil in kilo-newtons

element.name: spread_min
element.description: maximum accuracy spread (angle, in degrees) for a shot (defaults to zero, ignored for "thrown" and "melee" weapons).

element.name: spread_max
element.description: maximum accuracy spread (angle, in degrees) for a shot (defaults to zero, ignored for "thrown" and "melee" weapons).

element.name: spread_fine_aim_min
element.description: minimum accuracy spread(angle, in degrees) for a shot when using fine-aim (defaults to min spread, ignored for "thrown" and "melee" weapons).

element.name: spread_fine_aim_max
element.description: maximum accuracy spread(angle, in degrees) for a shot when using fine-aim (defaults to max spread, ignored for "thrown" and "melee" weapons).

element.name: npc_spread_min
element.description: same as "min. spread", but for npcs.

element.name: npc_spread_max
element.description: same as "max. spread", but for npcs.

element.name: to_spread_max
element.description: number of shots for the gun to go to max spread (defaults to zero, ignored for "thrown" and "melee" weapons).

element.name: to_spread_min
element.description: time (in milliseconds) for the gun to settle from maximum spread to minimum spread (defaults to zero, ignored for "thrown" and "melee" weapons).

element.name: spread_multiplier_run
element.description: spread multiplier when running (defaults to one, ignored for "thrown" and "melee" weapons).

element.name: ragdoll_force_shoot
element.description: how much force to apply to a ragdoll when shot by this weapon. 0 is none.

element.name: reload_delay
element.description: how many milliseconds to wait to auto reload after the player runs out of ammo.

element.name: overheat_cool_down_time
element.description: how long does the weapon take to cool down after overheating

element.name: overheat_percent_per_shot
element.description: how much does the weapon overheat per shot fired

element.name: dropped_ammo_scale
element.description: scales the ammo dropped by npcs in single player when they die. if not defined, all ammo is present in dropped weapon.

element.name: headshot_multiplier
element.description: how much to multiply the damage buy when an enemy is hit in the head

element.name: zoom_magnification
element.description: magnification for zoom mode. (2 is 2x zoom)

element.name: flags
element.description: flags for this weapon.

element.name: projectile_info
element.description: projectile parameters (only for "projectile" or "thrown" weapons).

element.name: model
element.description: the 3d model for the projectile.

element.name: start_speed
element.description: the start speed of a projectile in meters/sec

element.name: max_speed
element.description: max speed the projectile can accelerate to

element.name: fuse_time
element.description: time (in milliseconds) before projectile explodes (defaults to zero, i.e.: explode on impact).

element.name: attached_effect
element.description: trail effect that is attached to projectile.

element.name: attached_effect_description
element.description: breif description of what effect is used for. (this is not read into the game)

element.name: attached_effect2
element.description: another effect that is switched to after a event depending on the projectile type.

element.name: attached_effect2_description
element.description: breif description of what effect is used for. (this is not read into the game)

element.name: attached_effect3
element.description: another effect that is switched to after a event depending on the projectile type.

element.name: attached_effect3_description
element.description: breif description of what effect is used for. (this is not read into the game)

element.name: attached_effect4
element.description: another effect that is switched to after a event depending on the projectile type.

element.name: attached_effect4_description
element.description: breif description of what effect is used for. (this is not read into the game)

element.name: gravity
element.description: acceleration due to gravity on the projectile (defaults to -9.8 m/s^2).

element.name: sound
element.description: sound that the projectile makes while in flight.

element.name: mass
element.description: mass of projectile in kg. default 1kg. only projectiles that bounce need to worry about tweaking.

element.name: linear_damp
element.description: value between 0 and 1. higher value results in higher drag on linear velocity (ie less distance).

element.name: angular_damp
element.description: value between 0 1nd 1. higher value results in higher drag on angular velocity (ie less spin).

element.name: restitution
element.description: the restitution coefficient (usually a value from 0 to 1) specifies how much kinetic energy is lost during a collision between two objects e.g. with a value of 0, all energy is lost and objects appear to come to a complete halt when they collide. with a value of 1, no energy is lost and objects bounce off each other with an equal but opposite velocity. for values between 0 and 1, the objects lose some but not all energy with each collision.

element.name: friction
element.description: the friction coefficient (usually a value from 0 to 1) which specifies how "sticky" or "rough" an object is.

element.name: inaccurate_flight
element.description: projectile's flight is not on a linear path. this value is the magnitude of the error that occurs over time.

element.name: angular_velocity
element.description: starting angular velocity for projectile.

element.name: time_until_propelled
element.description: time in ms before a projectile is propelled.

element.name: hit_camera_shake
element.description: camera shake to play when a player is hit by this projectile

element.name: melee_group
element.description: define the group of effects to be used for melee attacks with this weapon.

element.name: meleeattacks
element.description: opening moves for melee attack combos

element.name: standingprimary
element.description: primary attack move while standing.

element.name: standingsecondary
element.description: secondary attack move while standing.

element.name: standingtertiary
element.description: tertiary attack move while standing.

element.name: crouchingprimary
element.description: primary attack move while crouching.

element.name: crouchingsecondary
element.description: secondary attack move while crouching.

element.name: crouchingtertiary
element.description: tertiary attack move while crouching.

element.name: damage_scaling_min
element.description: the damage that this weapon does at min distance or at low momentum.

element.name: threshold
npc_damage
element.description: the damage that this weapon does at min distance to npcs.

element.name: player_damage
element.description: the damage that this weapon does at min distance to the player.

element.name: vehicle_damage
element.description: the damage this weapon does at the minimun distance to the player

element.name: player_vehicle_damage
element.description: the damage this weapon does at the minimun distance to the player's vehicle.

element.name: damage_scaling_max
element.description: the damage that this weapon does at max distance or high momentum.

element.name: threshold
npc_damage
element.description: the damage that this weapon does at max distance to npcs.

element.name: player_damage
element.description: the damage that this weapon does at max distance to the player.

element.name: vehicle_damage
element.description: the damage this weapon does at the maximum distance to the player

element.name: player_vehicle_damage
element.description: the damage this weapon does at the minimun distance to the player's vehicle.

element.name: muzzle_flash
element.description: the muzzle flash effect for this weapon.

element.name: muzzle_smoke
element.description: the muzzle smoke effect for this weapon.

element.name: special_hit_effect
element.description: can be used for special weapons whose hit effects are not determined simply by the material they hit.

element.name: special_effect
element.description: special effect depends on the weapon type.

element.name: secondary_special_effect
element.description: secondary special effect depends on the weapon type.

element.name: fire_camera_shake
element.description: camera shake that plays when player fires the weapon.

element.name: secondary_camera_shake
element.description: camera shake that plays when player uses the secondary trigger.

element.name: player_hit_camera_shake
element.description: camera shake that plays when player is hit.

element.name: tracer_frequency
element.description: number of shots before a tracer is emitted (only for "burst" fire weapons).

element.name: tracer_effect
element.description: this is the effect that will be used as the tracer on bullet weapons.

element.name: sound_group
element.description: group the sounds are in for this weapon.

element.name: fire_sound
element.description: played when weapon is fired. (firearms only)

element.name: reload_sound
element.description: played when weapon is reloaded.

element.name: reload_sound_delay
element.description: the amount of time in ms before the reload sound is played (if there is one).

element.name: no_ammo_sound
element.description: played when attempting to reload weapon with no ammo in reserves.

element.name: special_sound
element.description: this sound's use depends on the weapon it is applied to.

element.name: secondary_sound
element.description: sound for the weapon's secondary function.

element.name: upgrade_sound
element.description: a sound used specifically for special upgrade functionality.

element.name: flyby_sound
element.description: the sound the bullet makes as it whizzes past the player. only for use with bullet-type weapons (i.e. not projectile weapons like the rpg or grinder).

element.name: sound_radius
element.description: radius of attack sound (in meters).

element.name: dummy
element.description: is this a dummy weapon entry, used only in mp? if you're not sure, leave it defaulted.
